holidays.name: National Oreo Cookie Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to celebrate the iconic black-and-white sandwich cookie loved around the world. Perfect for dunking in milk, baking into desserts, or just savoring plain!
holidays.origin: Created by Oreo enthusiasts to honor the cookie‚Äôs debut in 1912 by the National Biscuit Company (Nabisco).
holidays.funFact: More Oreo cookies are consumed in the US than people annually ‚Äî over 25 billion eaten every year!

holidays.name: Dentist's Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the heroes who keep our smiles healthy and bright. It‚Äôs a day to thank dentists for filling cavities and fighting plaque.
holidays.origin: Established to recognize dental professionals and educate people about oral hygiene.
holidays.funFact: March 6 was chosen because it honors the birthday of Dr. Charles Horace Mayo, one of the founders of the Mayo Clinic.

holidays.name: National Frozen Food Day
holidays.description: A chilly celebration of all things frozen, from veggies and meals to ice cream and popsicles. Perfect excuse to raid your freezer!
holidays.origin: Created to highlight the convenience and innovation of frozen food technology, which started gaining popularity in the early 20th century.
holidays.funFact: Did you know the first frozen meal patent was filed in 1950 by Swanson, who popularized TV dinners?

holidays.name: Creation of the Internet Day
holidays.description: An unofficial nod to the pioneers of the internet, commemorating a step toward the connected world we live in today.
holidays.origin: Marks the date in 1989 when Tim Berners-Lee proposed the idea for the World Wide Web.
holidays.funFact: Without this proposal, your funny cat videos and memes wouldn‚Äôt exist ‚Äî all hail Sir Tim Berners-Lee!
